item.title: Oh my Gowda: The story of a political family in Karnataka
item.description: They are going again. The Gowdas, who were once the leading political family in Karnataka, are in the news again for negative reasons. The accusation against Prajwal Revanna, the MP from Hassan and the grandson of HD Deve Gowda, and the son of HD Revanna and Bhavani, for what appears to be serial sexual harassment has surprised many, except those who have closely monitored the family.
item.creator: RAKESH PRAKASH

item.title: Shivam Dube: From Mumbai snub to India's T20 World Cup squad
item.description: Shivam Dube's exceptional performance in various tournaments, backed by Mumbai's Raju Kulkarni, led to his selection in India's T20 World Cup squad after a career turnaround highlighted by impressive displays in IPL and domestic cricket. During the 2022-23 domestic season, Dube played a vital part in Mumbai's Syed Mushtaq Ali T20 triumph (186 runs in 10 matches@62.00 & eight wickets@22.87) but Dube didn't get to play a game in either the Vijay Hazare Trophy or the Ranji Trophy.
item.creator: GAURAV GUPTA

item.title: Congress party is a 'mureed' of Pakistan: PM Modi
item.description: In a scathing attack on the Congress party, Prime Minister Narendra Modi alleged that the opposition party was subservient to Pakistan. He claimed that the neighboring nation was keen on seeing the Congress leader, whom he called 'shehzada', assume the role of India's next prime minister. The prime minister's comments were made just a day after Chaudhry Fawad Hussain, a former Pakistani minister, shared a video of Congress leader Rahul Gandhi on social media platforms and expressed admiration for him.
item.creator: TOI NEWS DESK

item.title: Obscene video case: Lookout notice for Prajwal Revanna
item.description: The suspended JD(S) functionary and Hassan MP Prajwal Revanna, who is the grandson of former Prime Minister HD Deve Gowda, has been issued a lookout notice by a special investigation team on Thursday. Prajwal is currently involved in a case related to an alleged sex video. The special investigation team has also summoned Prajwal and his father, HD Revanna, to appear for questioning in connection with the case.
item.creator: TOI NEWS DESK

item.title: In 5-way fight, Amritpal Singh is the X factor
item.description: Amritpal Singh's candidacy in Khadoor Sahib creates political ripples, with major party nominees vying for support. The constituency's historical significance and current challenges underscore the intense competition and need for development to address pressing issues.
item.creator: YUDHVIR RANA

item.title: Google cuts jobs in ‘Core team’: What top executives told employees
item.description: Google laid off 200 employees from Core teams, relocating roles to India and Mexico. Part of downsizing effort impacting online safety, Python tools, app platforms. Asim Husain and Pankaj Rohatgi commented on expansion.
item.creator: TOI TECH DESK

item.title: Is your bank overcharging you on loan interest? Check 4 ways
item.description: RBI uncovers unfair loan interest practices, orders refunds, and KFS implementation by October 1, 2024 for transparent loan terms and fair borrower treatment.
item.creator: TOI BUSINESS DESK

item.title: Read notice sent to Labour Board by Google employees fired over Israel protests
item.description: Around 50 Google employees were fired last month for protesting against the Israel government contract. They filed a complaint with US labour regulators, alleging unlawful termination and seeking reinstatement, back pay, and respect for their right to organize.
item.creator: TOI TECH DESK

item.title: Adani Ports report 77% YoY jump in profit in Q4
item.description: Adani Ports and Special Economic Zone reported a 77% year-on-year jump in its consolidated net profit, reaching Rs 2,014.77 crore for Q4 FY24.
item.creator: TOI BUSINESS DESK

item.title: Kunal Ghosh alleges TMC's involvement in teachers recruitment scam
item.description: Kunal Ghosh accuses TMC of being aware of teachers recruitment scam pre-2021 polls. Partha Chatterjee's shift due to corruption info. Chatterjee apprehended for SSC scam. CBI arrests TMC leaders. Calcutta HC cancels SLST-2016, leading to job loss.
item.creator: TOI NEWS DESK

item.title: Amazon Great Summer Sale: Check out best deals & offers
item.description: Amazon Great Summer Sale offers a wide selection of products at discounted prices, including smartwatches, microwave ovens, and audio accessories like headphones and earbuds with cashback offers. Take a look at some of the best deals you can find on the Amazon Great Summer Sale.
item.creator: AAHNA SHARMA

item.title: Meta claims IT rules misuse, after HC rap comparing it to govt department
item.description: Delhi High Court warned Meta to improve operations amidst concerns over social media handling. Meta defended blocking a magazine's account due to copyright strikes and lack of response.
item.creator: TOI TECH DESK

item.title: Amit Shah fake video case: Telangana cops arrest 5 from Cong IT cell
item.description: Telangana Congress IT members arrested over fake Amit Shah video. Jharkhand Congress president and Telangana CM summoned. More details awaited.
item.creator: TOI CITY DESK

item.title: Who is next? Scandal fear stalks netas in Karnataka
item.description: The sex scandal involving Karnataka MP Prajwal Revanna may lead to more incriminating videos, sparking concerns about retaliatory actions and the dissemination of defamatory material amidst escalating turmoil.
item.creator: MANUAIYAPPA KANATHANDA

item.title: In a first, refugee Rohingya kids from Hyderabad all set to study in top US varsities
item.description: Rohingya refugee children from Hyderabad secure scholarships to study at top US and Canadian universities, with dreams of uplifting their community. Shaik Usman, among others, aims to pursue medicine and return to help his people in Bangladesh.
item.creator: SUDIPTA SENGUPTA

item.title: Paytm Money CEO Varun steps down; Rakesh Singh to take charge
item.description: Paytm Money, the wealth management platform of One 97 Communications Ltd, has appointed Rakesh Singh as its new CEO, replacing Varun Sridhar. Singh, previously the CEO of broking services at PayU-backed Fisdom, joined Paytm Money recently. Under Sridhar's leadership, Paytm Money achieved profitability with a net profit of Rs 42.8 crore in FY23.
item.creator: TOI BUSINESS DESK

item.title: Covid-19 'FLiRT' variants: What you need to know
item.creator: TOI SCIENCE DESK

item.title: Bengaluru woman loses Rs 2.7 crore to cybercrooks, gets back Rs 1.7 crore after timely plaint
item.description: A 52-year-old woman lost Rs 2.7 crore to cybercrooks but will recover Rs 1.7 crore after police froze the miscreants' bank accounts. Prompt action led to one of the highest sums returned to a cybercrime victim.
item.creator: RAJIV KALKOD

item.title: 'Our votebank is every Indian': Kharge writes to PM Modi
item.description: In a letter addressed to Prime Minister Narendra Modi, Mallikarjun Kharge, the Congress chief, expressed his concerns regarding the Prime Minister's recent communication to NDA candidates. Kharge pointed out that the language employed in the letter seemed to reflect a sense of desperation and anxiety, which he deemed inappropriate for the esteemed office of the Prime Minister.
item.creator: TOI NEWS DESK

item.title: Mother & newborn die after C-section under torchlight
item.description: Saheedunnissa Ansari's tragic torchlight delivery at Sushma Swaraj maternity home resulted in her death at Sion Hospital. BMC committee probes possible medical negligence as protests seek answers.
item.creator: TNN

item.title: Madras HC allows girl to use diaper during NEET exam on May 5
item.description: NEET applicant with special needs granted permission by Madras high court to wear a diaper and change it as required during the NEET-UG exam, ensuring equal opportunities for all candidates.
item.creator: KAUSHIK KANNAN

item.title: Telecom equipment production crosses Rs 45,000cr milestone
item.description: Telecom equipment manufacturing in India has seen significant growth, with exports exceeding Rs 10,500 crore in the financial year 2024. The production linked incentive (PLI) scheme has played a crucial role in this success, creating over 19,500 direct jobs.
item.creator: TOI BUSINESS DESK

item.title: LG VK Saxena sacks 223 employees of Delhi women's commission
item.description: Lieutenant Governor VK Saxena has directed the immediate dismissal of 223 Delhi Women's Commission employees. These individuals were recruited by ex-chairperson Swati Maliwal, allegedly without approvals, breaching established protocols.
item.creator: TOI CITY DESK

item.title: 32-year-old man dies during workout at Varanasi gym
item.description: Deepak Gupta, a 32-year-old fitness enthusiast, tragically died after experiencing a severe headache while at a gym in Varanasi on Wednesday. CCTV footage captured Gupta holding his head, trembling, and receiving assistance from others. Despite being rushed to a medical facility, he was pronounced dead upon arrival. Gupta had been a dedicated gym-goer for the past decade.
item.creator: TOI CITY DESK

item.title: Saudi Arabia steps up arrests of those attacking Israel online
item.description: In Saudi Arabia, arresting individuals for online posts, including those made more than a decade ago, and imposing limitations on freedom of expression and political speech are commonplace. However, according to diplomats based in Riyadh and human rights organizations, the recent wave of arrests is driven by security concerns directly related to the deadly invasion of Israel by Hamas on October 7 and its subsequent consequences.
item.creator: Bloomberg

item.title: 'CBI not under Union govt's control': Centre to SC on Bengal govt's lawsuit
item.description: Supreme Court addressed Centre's objections to West Bengal's lawsuit over CBI investigations post consent withdrawal. Tushar Mehta highlighted misuse of Article 131. West Bengal withdrew consent in November 2018.
item.creator: TOI NEWS DESK

item.title: Micron to export 1st batch of India-made semiconductor chips in '25
item.description: Micron India aims to release semiconductor chips packaged at its Sanand facility in Gujarat for export by early next year. The company plans to cater to global demand for chips, with a focus on data centers, smartphones, notebooks, IoT devices, and automotive segments.
item.creator: TOI BUSINESS DESK

item.title: When bomb hoax at 200 schools in Delhi-NCR led to panic
item.description: Delhi-NCR faced bomb threats at 200 schools, causing panic. Authorities traced the sender, involving various agencies. The situation led to traffic congestion and unexpected interruptions but was declared a hoax by noon.
item.creator: RAJ SHEKHAR

item.title: Flights cancelled, residents told to stay indoors: UAE faces heavy rains again
item.description: The UAE is currently experiencing severe weather conditions, prompting the issuance of an orange alert. Heavy rains and thunderstorms have engulfed the region, disrupting normal life and leading to a series of precautionary measures. On Thursday, as the unstable weather reached its peak, residents were advised to stay indoors, and remote work was enforced across both public and private sectors.
item.creator: TOI WORLD DESK

item.title: Congress maintains suspense on Amethi, Rae Bareli choice
item.description: Decision pending on Gandhi siblings' UP contest. Media speculates Rahul may skip Amethi. State unit urges traditional seat contest. Concerns about leaving Wayanad. Rahul's travel plans. Priyanka tours Chhattisgarh, MP. BJP delays candidate announcement.
item.creator: TNN

item.title: Despite candidate change, it’s still an uphill task for BJP in Ladakh
item.description: Unrest in Ladakh affects BJP's election. Gyalson replaces Namgyal. People demand legislative assembly. Wangchuk led hunger strike. Ladakh now separate Union Territory without legislature, causing disillusionment among residents.
item.creator: M SALEEM PANDIT

item.title: Sex tapes case: Prajwal may return from Germany this weekend
item.description: Suspended JD(S) functionary Prajwal Revanna, embroiled in sex video case, to return from Germany on May 3-4, breaking silence. CID in contact, CM wrote to PM. Visit followed Lok Sabha polls.
item.creator: TNN

item.title: India may ease curbs on Chinese investment on hi-tech electronics
item.description: India is considering allowing Chinese electronics firms to invest on a case-by-case basis. The Ministry of Electronics and IT has reached out to Shanghai Highly for investment strategies, signaling a shift in policy. Indian companies, like Voltas, are seeking partnerships amidst regulatory hurdles.
item.creator: TOI BUSINESS DESK

item.title: Ex-WC winner reveals the X-factor of Rohit-led Indian team
item.description: Former Indian cricketer Madan Lal has named Rishabh Pant as a potential game-changer for Rohit Sharma's Indian team for the upcoming T20 World Cup. Lal believes India could dominate the tournament if Pant is in front. Lal praised Pant's comeback and said India's success depends on his performance, team position, and usage. Pant is considered one of the top batsmen globally.
item.creator: JYOTIRMOY HALDER

item.title: 'Thala for a reason': Punjab's banter sparks social media frenzy
item.description: Punjab Kings won the Indian Premier League match against Chennai Super Kings on Wednesday, extending their winning streak and sparking a playful exchange around the 'Thala for a reason' meme. Their witty social media presence, featuring references to the meme, stole the spotlight during the match. The match was a testament to PBKS' dominance.
item.creator: TOI SPORTS DESK

item.title: NEET UG admit card: Students still unable to download, here's why
item.description: As the National Eligibility cum Entrance Test (NEET) Undergraduate (UG) exam date approaches, students across the country face a significant hurdle in downloading their admit cards due to technical glitches. Despite the availability of the admit card link, a substantial number of aspirants remain unable to access this crucial document necessary for appearing in the exam. This synopsis delves into the underlying reasons behind this persistent issue.
item.creator: TOI Education

item.title: Mahindra XUV 3XO vs Tata Nexon: Which one offers better prices, features
item.description: Mahindra XUV 3XO and Tata Nexon compete in the compact SUV segment. The XUV 3XO offers competitive pricing, segment-first features like a panoramic sunroof and ADAS suite, advanced infotainment system, and various premium features.
item.creator: TIMESOFINDIA.COM

item.title: Maruti Suzuki car bets on new generation Swift and Dzire models
item.description: Maruti Suzuki India plans to sell approximately 2 million vehicles this fiscal year, aiming to surpass the domestic industry. The company's targeted growth exceeds industry projections, driven by new model launches such as Swift and Dzire.
item.creator: TOI BUSINESS DESK
